text: Robert Floyd Curl Jr. (August 23, 1933 â€“ July 3, 2022) was an American chemist. He was a professor of Natural Sciences and Professor of Chemistry at Rice University. He won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1996 for the discovery of the nanomaterial buckminsterfullerene. Curl died in Houston, Texas on July 3, 2022, at the age of 88. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American chemists Category:Scientists from San Antonio, Texas Category:Educators from San Antonio, Texas Category:Academics from Texas Category:People from Alice, Texas
title: Robert Curl
